1555707064_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92T.body:
>if the appointment is inevitable why not influence it in the best possible way? Vote Yang!

Have you even looked at the guy one second? 

>His campaign proposes a $1,000/month "Freedom Dividend" to all U.S. citizens over the age of 18 (a form of universal basic income) and other responses to predictions of mass unemployment from technological automation

One loaf of bread will probably cost you $100 after Yang

>**Yang supports a Green New Deal** and favors a reduction in carbon emissions with an emphasis on climate engineering. In addition to revitalizing the Environmental Protection Agency, his platform calls for a Global Geoengineering Institute to form inter-governmental partnerships. Yang is a proponent of a carbon tax and bringing the United States back into the Paris Climate Agreement

Yay! Tax us for exhaling CO2 (plant food)

>On April 3, 2019, Yang came out in favor of lowering the national voting age to 16

Children make the wisest decisions, not that voting matters much.

For more information on why the Green New Deal is such a bad thing, watch: 

https://invidio.us/watch?v=gjqBsbqv3-M
